New Records: Jackson Chourio became the second-youngest player in postseason history to hit two game-tying home runs.
The Brewers' comeback from a 5-1 deficit in the seventh inning was the second such in the Wild Card Round since 2022.
Key Match Events: Brewers tied the game with two home runs in the eighth inning.
Willy Adames' two-out hit was crucial for the go-ahead run.
Mets' defensive plays, including Francisco Lindor's double play, were significant.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers' manager Pat Murphy praised the team's resilience.
Garrett Mitchell expressed pride in the win.
Mets' manager Carlos Mendoza discussed missed opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at American Family Field in Milwaukee.
The Brewers' victory marked their first in a postseason game trailing entering the seventh inning since 1982.
